com.prc.alp.liaison.interact
Class CoABSRegistryInteractor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.prc.alp.liaison.interact.CoABSRegistryInteractor
public class CoABSRegistryInteractor
extends java.lang.Object
implements MultithreadInteractor

A manager of interactions involving registration with the CoABS Grid. It supports the registration of ALP/Cougaar agents with the Grid's Jini lookup service by supplying a CoABS-defined agent description. Although these registrations can be done without message passing, this implementation uses an optional Grid feature to accept a confirming ACL message back from the registry when the registration process is complete. Because it accepts incoming messages through a separate thread of control from the one that initiates its interactions, this must be a MultithreadInteractor.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1

nextAction

public ActionType nextAction(java.lang.Object o,
                             Interaction iaction,
                             boolean priorActExpired)
Description copied from interface: Interactor
Selects the next action to be performed in the course of a given Interaction
Tags copied from interface: Interactor
Parameters:
o - An arbitrary object representing the current state of an Interaction instance
iaction - A reference to a particular Interaction
priorActExpired - false if the just-finished prior action completed normally or with a (non-timeout) error; true if the just-finished prior action was interrupted by a timeout. If the prior act did expire, the current state is the same as the one provided in the prior call to nextAction; in other words, nextAction will be called twice successively with the same state (but the second time the value of priorActExpired will be true). This allows it to perform some intelligent action in the event of an action timeout, such as trying a different action, or trying the same action with a different timeout. (Note that the ActionType returned includes a specification of the action timeout for the next action to perform.)
Returns:
The next action to be performed in the course of the particular Interaction

handle

public boolean handle(java.lang.Object obj,
                      java.lang.Object context,
                      Interaction iaction)
Description copied from interface: MultithreadInteractor
Performs whatever action is required to react to an arbitrary object supplied to a particular Interaction instance by a separate thread. It may choose to ignore the object altogether.
Specified by:
handle in interface MultithreadInteractor
Tags copied from interface: MultithreadInteractor
Parameters:
obj - An arbitrary object representing something (typically a received message or other information) that an existing Interaction instance may need to react to
context - An arbitrary object representing some contextual information supplied to this interactor
iaction - A reference to a particular Interaction
Returns:
true if this interactor accepted and handled the given object; false otherwise
